<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>Because it's hard to let go of summer, let's compare various "beach with umbrella" emojis: <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/198/beach-with-umbrella_1f3d6.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/google/146/beach-with-umbrella_1f3d6.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/twitter/214/beach-with-umbrella_1f3d6.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/facebook/200/beach-with-umbrella_1f3d6.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/samsung/161/beach-with-umbrella_1f3d6.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/lg/57/beach-with-umbrella_1f3d6.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TOURISM
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/18/retails-struggling-downturn-tourist-spending?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
I ❤ NY a Little Less, Say Tourists
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="I ❤ NY a Little Less, Say Tourists" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY2MTQ1MjE2LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Image by <a href="https://pixabay.com/users/ahundt-663354/?utm_source=link-attribution&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=image&utm_content=1587558" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">A. H.</a> from <a href="https://pixabay.com/?utm_source=link-attribution&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=image&utm_content=1587558" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Pixabay</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Retailers have a problem not named Bezos: </strong>A decline in tourist spending.<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Macy’s </strong></span><span>said last Wednesday sales from international tourists </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/slower-tourist-traffic-adds-to-retailers-woes-11565970914?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fell 9%</a></span><span> in Q2. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Tapestry,</strong></span><span> the owner of Coach and Kate Spade, </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/9b21b2fa-bfae-11e9-89e2-41e555e96722?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">blamed</a></span><span> a bad quarter for Coach on “pressure from lower tourist spend” in North America. Shares tanked 22% last Thursday. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Tiffany’s </strong></span><span>U.S. sales to Chinese tourists </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-06-04/tiffany-s-u-s-sales-to-chinese-tourists-drop-by-more-than-25?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dropped over 25%</a></span><span> in the first quarter, a major issue considering foreign tourists account for a low-double-digit percentage of its U.S. sales. </span><span><strong style="color:#000"> </strong></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Focus on China  </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The headline stat: </strong>In 2018, the number of Chinese tourists to the U.S. <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-05-28/chinese-tourism-to-us-drops-for-1st-time-in-15-years?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fell 5.7%</a>, the first annual decrease since 2003. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s a problem for businesses. According to the National Travel and Tourism Office, Chinese nationals contribute more to the U.S. economy than tourists from any other country. On average, they <a href="https://www.npr.org/2019/05/31/728590535/chinese-tourism-to-u-s-is-down-after-years-of-booming-growth?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stay 18 nights</a> and spend almost $7,000 per trip, 50% more than other international visitors. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s getting so bad, the number of Chinese visitors to Hawaii dropped more than 23% through the first four months of 2019. Who could possibly resist going to Hawaii? </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Diagnosing the trend</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While it’s impossible to quantify the effect of the U.S.-China trade war on tourism, the Chinese government did <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2019/06/04/china-warns-against-traveling-us-citing-shootings-robberies-theft/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">warn its citizens</a> in early June about traveling to the U.S. (cited risks include “harassment” from law enforcement and shootings and robberies). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The depreciation of China’s yuan relative to the dollar has also made a U.S. visit far more expensive. Many would-be Chinese tourists are opting to buy luxury items closer to home. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>While the U.S. is looking to boost visitors, other hotspots around the globe are <a href="https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2019/06/crowds-tourists-are-ruining-popular-destinations/590767/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gasping for air</a>. New Zealand approved a <a href="https://www.travelpulse.com/news/impacting-travel/new-zealand-approves-new-tourist-tax.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tax</a> on most international tourists, Louvre employees staged a walkout in May to protest overcrowding, and Amsterdam is <a href="https://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/2019/09/the-war-on-tourists/594766/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">banning</a> guided tours of its Red Light District starting January 1.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INVESTING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/18/softbanks-got-thing-leverage?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
SoftBank's Got a Thing for Leverage
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Whatever work/life balance SoftBank employees had until now is probably going out the window. The WSJ <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/softbank-to-lend-founder-and-employees-billions-to-invest-in-fund-11566051247?mod=hp_lead_pos4&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports</a> the Japanese conglomerate will lend up to $20 billion to its employees to buy stakes in Vision Fund 2, the potentially colossal sequel to its first venture fund. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why this is not normal: </strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>While employees managing a fund are supposed to have some “skin in the game,” the typical employee contribution is less than 5% of total funds raised, </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/002a640c-bfe7-11e9-b350-db00d509634e?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the FT</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>SoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son wants to raise at least $108 billion for VF2. So allowing employees to borrow and invest nearly one-fifth of that amount led some tech writers to </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/shiraovide/status/1162793060612354048?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">react</a></span><span> with a “Good gracious, WHAT?”</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Masa’s line of thinking: </strong>Our bets from the first Vision Fund on DoorDash and Slack <a href="https://news.crunchbase.com/news/heres-what-softbanks-earnings-tell-us-about-how-the-vision-fund-is-performing/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">made a killing</a> in Q2. By increasing our own stake in VF2, we can better hold ourselves accountable and profit from the successful investments. Also, if this works everybody’s heads will explode.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/18/leaked-documents-show-perils-nodeal-brexit?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Contingency Planning, Brexit Style
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Contingency Planning, Brexit Style" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/MZLTbdwEPNvXAxvrly/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Contingency Planning, Brexit Style" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/MZLTbdwEPNvXAxvrly/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’ve been writing for years that of all possible Brexit scenarios, businesses fear a “no deal” situation the most. Now, leaked government documents <a href="https://www.thetimes.co.uk/edition/news/operation-chaos-whitehalls-secret-no-deal-brexit-plan-leaked-j6ntwvhll?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">obtained</a> by the Sunday Times show why.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If the U.K. leaves the EU <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2019/08/18/leaked-memo-says-britain-faces-economic-social-chaos-if-it-goes-through-with-no-deal-brexit/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">without a deal</a> on Oct. 31, say the documents, the country could face…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Shortages of fresh food, medicine, and fuel</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Disruptions at ports for several months</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The closure of two oil refineries</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Social unrest and the restoration of a “hard border” with Ireland </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>An influx of filmmakers shooting zombie flicks</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Michael Gove, the minister leading no-deal preparations, said the docs were <a href="https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-britain-eu-gove-nodeal/gove-no-deal-brexit-will-mean-bumps-in-the-road-idUKKCN1V80HR?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">out of date</a> but conceded that leaving the EU without a deal would cause "bumps in the road." Industry groups say there are only so many bumps <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/07db4722-c189-11e9-a8e9-296ca66511c9?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">small businesses</a> can absorb. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>new prime minister Boris Johnson said he’s going to take the U.K. out of the EU by Halloween, deal or no deal. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
IPO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/18/googles-celebrating-ipos-15th-birthday?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Happy 15th B-Day, Google IPO
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On this day 15 years ago, an exciting internet search company went public in an unusual, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2014/08/19/es-took-off-but-the-auction-didnt.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">auction-style format</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Set the scene: </strong>The Red Sox had just traded Nomar Garciaparra to the Cubs, the world met Ron Burgundy for the first time in July, and eBay, worth $49 billion, was the world’s <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2004/07/27/business/as-it-goes-public-google-says-it-is-worth-up-to-36-billion.html?_r=0&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most valuable</a> internet company.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We all know what happened to Google/Alphabet's stock price next.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1566152264.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><em>Where'd we get this? Google, obviously. </em></sup></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We dusted off Google's OG <a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1288776/000119312504073639/ds1.htm?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">SEC filing</a> for any interesting nuggets of info. Here are a few...<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Motto: </strong></span><span>“Don’t be evil.” </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Competitors:</strong></span><span> “Currently, we consider our primary competitors to be Microsoft and Yahoo.”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Privacy:</strong></span><span> “People have raised privacy concerns relating to the ability of our recently announced Gmail email service to match relevant ads to the content of email messages...Publicity regarding such concerns could harm our brand.”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Valuation: </strong></span><span>Worth </span><span><a href="https://techcrunch.com/2017/07/31/a-look-back-in-ipo-google-the-profit-machine/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">roughly $23 billion</a></span><span>, Google went public at a valuation </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2017/03/01/snapchat-ipo-pricing.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lower than Snap's</a></span><span> (~$24 billion) when it IPO'd in 2017.</span>
</li>
</ul>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We only get to say this once every year: This Thursday, Wyoming will become the center of the economic universe. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Monday: </strong>Earnings (Estee Lauder, Baidu); e-commerce retail sales; Bill Clinton turns 73; National Aviation Day </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tuesday: </strong>Earnings (Home Depot, Medtronic, TJX, Kohl’s, Urban Outfitters) </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wednesday: </strong>Existing home sales; FOMC minutes; earnings (RBC, Lowe’s, Target, Nordstrom)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Thursday: </strong>Jackson Hole Economic Symposium begins; earnings (Salesforce, Intuit, VMware, Gap, Dick’s); jobless claims; loosen up your molars for National Tooth Fairy Day </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Friday: </strong>New home sales</p>

#1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eblamed\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e a bad quarter for Coach on “pressure from lower tourist spend” in North America. Shares tanked 22% last Thursday. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTiffany’s \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eU.S. sales to Chinese tourists \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-06-04/tiffany-s-u-s-sales-to-chinese-tourists-drop-by-more-than-25?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edropped over 25%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in the first quarter, a major issue considering foreign tourists account for a low-double-digit percentage of its U.S. sales. \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eFocus on China  \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe headline stat: \u003c/strong\u003eIn 2018, the number of Chinese tourists to the U.S. \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-05-28/chinese-tourism-to-us-drops-for-1st-time-in-15-years?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efell 5.7%\u003c/a\u003e, the first annual decrease since 2003. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat’s a problem for businesses. According to the National Travel and Tourism Office, Chinese nationals contribute more to the U.S. economy than tourists from any other country. On average, they \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2019/05/31/728590535/chinese-tourism-to-u-s-is-down-after-years-of-booming-growth?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estay 18 nights\u003c/a\u003e and spend almost $7,000 per trip, 50% more than other international visitors. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s getting so bad, the number of Chinese visitors to Hawaii dropped more than 23% through the first four months of 2019. Who could possibly resist going to Hawaii? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eDiagnosing the trend\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile it’s impossible to quantify the effect of the U.S.-China trade war on tourism, the Chinese government did \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2019/06/04/china-warns-against-traveling-us-citing-shootings-robberies-theft/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewarn its citizens\u003c/a\u003e in early June about traveling to the U.S. (cited risks include “harassment” from law enforcement and shootings and robberies). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe depreciation of China’s yuan relative to the dollar has also made a U.S. visit far more expensive. Many would-be Chinese tourists are opting to buy luxury items closer to home. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eWhile the U.S. is looking to boost visitors, other hotspots around the globe are \u003ca href=\"https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2019/06/crowds-tourists-are-ruining-popular-destinations/590767/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egasping for air\u003c/a\u003e. New Zealand approved a \u003ca href=\"https://www.travelpulse.com/news/impacting-travel/new-zealand-approves-new-tourist-tax.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etax\u003c/a\u003e on most international tourists, Louvre employees staged a walkout in May to protest overcrowding, and Amsterdam is \u003ca href=\"https://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/2019/09/the-war-on-tourists/594766/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebanning\u003c/a\u003e guided tours of its Red Light District starting January 1.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhatever work/life balance SoftBank employees had until now is probably going out the window. The WSJ \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/softbank-to-lend-founder-and-employees-billions-to-invest-in-fund-11566051247?mod=hp_lead_pos4\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereports\u003c/a\u003e the Japanese conglomerate will lend up to $20 billion to its employees to buy stakes in Vision Fund 2, the potentially colossal sequel to its first venture fund. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy this is not normal: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWhile employees managing a fund are supposed to have some “skin in the game,” the typical employee contribution is less than 5% of total funds raised, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/002a640c-bfe7-11e9-b350-db00d509634e?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper the FT\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eSoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son wants to raise at least $108 billion for VF2. So allowing employees to borrow and invest nearly one-fifth of that amount led some tech writers to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/shiraovide/status/1162793060612354048?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereact\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e with a “Good gracious, WHAT?”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMasa’s line of thinking: \u003c/strong\u003eOur bets from the first Vision Fund on DoorDash and Slack \u003ca href=\"https://news.crunchbase.com/news/heres-what-softbanks-earnings-tell-us-about-how-the-vision-fund-is-performing/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emade a killing\u003c/a\u003e in Q2. By increasing our own stake in VF2, we can better hold ourselves accountable and profit from the successful investments.
